ZoneText: Phone thief trips & hits head during chase, dies

Mumbai: After a 30-year-old man suspected of robbery was found dead on a street at Malad East, Kurar police began an investigation to find out whether he had been lynched. A probe has shown that while he was being chased, the man tripped and fell, resulting in a severe head injury and subsequent death.
The incident occurred at around 4am on Monday at MHB Colony in Malad East. The police received a call from locals that a man was lying in apool of blood near a drain. He was taken to a hospital where doctors pronounced him dead. He was identified as Kisan Mishra. During inquiries, police learnt that Mishra had snatched the cellphone of the owner of a Chinese cuisine stall. “When Mishra started to run with the stolen phone, the stall owner noticed him and called out for help. Locals and the stall owner started to chase Mishra,” a police officer said.
TNN
